means: [人名] [南方英格兰人姓氏] 雷德伍德住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“红+树林”(red+wood)

sentence.Network_en: I've heard that many redwood trees are thousands of years old.
sentence.Network_cn: 我听说许多红杉都有几千年的树龄.

sentence.Network_en: Its banks were shaded by cottonwood and redwood trees.
sentence.Network_cn: 河流的两岸被棉花树和红木树遮蔽住了。

sentence.Network_en: Wood from one redwood tree is worth $ 8,000.
sentence.Network_cn: 一棵红杉树所生成的木料价值为8000美金.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 巨杉和加州另一著名树种红杉（Redwood）是同一科。巨杉很粗，红杉细一些但更高。
和红木(Redwood)相比较, 红杉木没有像红木那麽高, 但是红杉木的树干比较大. 红木长得很慢, 不过它可以长得很高很高. 我在国王峡谷.
最高的树是红杉树(redwood)，同属一科，生长在北加州的红杉国家公园(Redwood National Park)。巨杉很粗，胖乎乎，红杉相对细一 …
吉他制作的木材有哪些？_爱问知识人 ... purpleheart 紫心木 redwood 红杉木 teak 柚木.

entry.tran: 红杉(产于美国加利福尼亚州)
entry.def: A redwood is an extremely tall tree which grows in California.

means.word_mean: 1. the soft reddish wood of either of two species of sequoia trees
2. either of two huge coniferous California trees that reach a height of 300 feet; sometimes placed in the Taxodiaceae

sentences.en: Have you ever visited a redwood forest?
I’ve heard that many redwood trees are thousands of years old.
sentences.cn: 我听说许多红杉都有几千年的树龄。
